title: A year into war, Ukrainians are plugging Japan’s tech talent gap
description: A scholarship programme aims to help displaced Ukrainians find jobs while addressing Japan's chronic labour shortages.

title: US Air Force releases new image of suspected Chinese spy balloon
description: The photograph was taken from the cockpit of a U-2 spy plane as it flew above the alleged surveillance balloon on Feb 3.

title: US Supreme Court weighs Twitter’s role in sharing ISIL content
description: Top US court considers second lawsuit this week over whether social media companies are liable for 'terrorist' content.

title: Wagner chief: Mercenaries slaughtered because of ‘shell hunger’
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin has repeatedly accused Russia's military brass of deliberately starving his fighters of munitions.

title: Will Russia’s suspension of nuclear treaty trigger an arms race?
description: Russia withdraws its participation from the last remaining nuclear treaty with the US.

title: Canada debates how to address asylum seekers entering from US
description: Government of Quebec says that it does not have the capacity to provide resources for rising number of asylum seekers.

title: Tunisia police arrest prominent figures as crackdown continues
description: The arrests come amid a continuing crackdown on critics of President Kais Saied.

title: Nuclear war no closer despite treaty move, Russian official says
description: Despite the decision to suspend participation, Russia says it will still abide by the New START arms reduction treaty.

title: Winter storm lashes northern United States with snow, ice, wind
description: Thousands of flights are cancelled or delayed, schools and businesses close as winter storm moves across US.

title: UN court orders Azerbaijan to end Nagorno-Karabakh roadblock
description: Lachin Corridor, the only land route giving Armenia direct access to Nagorno-Karabakh, has been blocked since December.

title: Drought in Horn of Africa worse than in 2011 famine
description: Below-normal rainfall is expected over the next three months in parts of Somalia, Kenya and Ethiopia.

title: ‘All of Ukraine is a battlefield’: Lessons about modern war
description: What has Russia's war in Ukraine taught us about how future conflicts will be fought?

title: Saudi Arabia sends first female team to global tennis event
description: Four Saudi players are taking part in the juniors category of Billie Jean King Cup qualifiers in Sri Lanka this week.

title: Photos: Israeli troops raid Nablus, kill 10 Palestinians
description: Palestinian officials say more than 100 people injured in Israeli army's latest raid in occupied territories.

title: Pakistan’s defence and spy chiefs discuss security with Taliban
description: High-level delegation visits Afghanistan's capital, days after closure of major border crossing between two countries.

title: Russia rules out testing hypersonic missile during naval exercise
description: Head of Russian naval contingent says Zircon missile will not be deployed during drills off South Africa's coastline.

title: Putin is trying to wait out Western support for Ukraine
description: To counter his strategy, the West should offer Kyiv a formal alliance.

title: Civilians face heightened danger from Colombia’s landmines
description: New violence in Colombia's decades-long conflict has impeded de-mining efforts, putting rural populations at risk.

title: What is the New START nuclear deal and why did Russia suspend it?
description: As Putin freezes the treaty between Russia and the US, we look at the deal and the implications of the suspension.

title: Russia’s war in Ukraine: After a year of conflict, what next?
description: Seven experts predict possible scenarios as neither Moscow nor Kyiv appears ready to negotiate a peaceful end to war.

title: China mine collapse: 2 dead, 50 trapped in Inner Mongolia region
description: A preliminary investigation showed that more than 50 people were trapped under the mine, according to the state media.

title: Tunisia’s Saied says migration aimed at changing demography
description: Rights activists criticise president's comments, say they are intended to 'create an imaginary enemy'.

title: Shamima Begum loses UK citizenship appeal
description: Begum, 23, loses bid to overturn 2019 decision to revoke her citizenship on national security grounds.

title: The problem with Israel’s so called ‘crisis of democracy’
description: Is the new Netanyahu government really on course to 'destroy Israeli democracy'?

title: Tight fiscal leash awaits winner of Nigeria presidential election
description: Ahead of the election, Africa's largest economy is in a precarious position due to rising debt and low revenue.

title: Tight fiscal leash awaits winner of Nigeria presidential election
description: Ahead of the election, Africa's largest economy is in a precarious position due to rising debt and low revenue.

title: Palestinian parties condemn PA over UN vote withdrawal
description: The PA reportedly withdrew a draft resolution against illegal Israeli settlements following a deal with the US.

title: Israeli forces kill two Palestinians in Nablus raid
description: Dozens of Palestinians also wounded and taken to hospital after Israeli raid in occupied West Bank city.

title: Imran Khan’s party launches ‘fill the jails’ protest in Pakistan
description: PTI begins drive from eastern city of Lahore, where authorities impose restrictions on public gatherings in some areas.

title: The world must not abandon northwest Syria (again)
description: As the February 6 earthquakes move down the global news agenda, we should not forget the promises we made to Syrians.

title: Price of love in Shatila: A Palestinian couple searches for home
description: As two young Palestinians try to start a life together in a Beirut refugee camp, they face problems setting up a home.

title: A Ukrainian refugee works three jobs to support her family
description: High living costs in Poland mean Zakhida may need a fourth job to support her mother and daughter.

title: Engineers count cost of rebuilding in quake-hit, war-weary Syria
description: Demolish or repair? Teams assess structures in the northwestern region where infrastructure was already dilapidated.

title: US grants extradition of Peru’s former President Alejandro Toledo
description: Toledo, who was Peru's president from 2001 to 2006, is accused of taking bribes in extensive corruption scandal.

title: ‘Breath of fresh air’: Haiti qualify for first Women’s World Cup
description: Haiti beat Chile to qualify for first FIFA World Cup tournament, which will be hosted by New Zealand and Australia.

title: S Korea breaks record for world’s lowest fertility rate, again
description: The number of babies expected per woman in South Korea dropped to 0.78 last year, down from 0.81 a year earlier.

title: With minutes to pack as bombs fell, this is what they took
description: As Russia invaded Ukraine a year ago, thousands rushed to leave. These are the objects they brought with them.

title: Seattle becomes first US city to ban caste discrimination
description: Advocates have long argued that pre-existing federal anti-discrimination laws do not extend to caste.

title: Not an era for war, says India as G20 finance meet begins
description: India says it is time for dialogue and diplomacy as G20 finance officials meet near the southern city of Bengaluru.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 364
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 364th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Saudi Arabia deposits $1bn in Yemen’s Aden-based central bank
description: The deposit comes as the Saudi-backed administration struggles to handle weak currency and high fuel prices.

title: Iran blames US for delay in prisoner swap deal
description: It remains unclear whether an agreement can be finalised as Tehran maintains Washington is acting in bad faith.

title: China, Japan hold first security talks in four years
description: Beijing and Tokyo square off over military buildup, Russia and spy balloons in first security dialogue in four years.

title: Hong Kong flags handouts to support recovery from COVID shock
description: Government says it will issue vouchers worth 5,000 Hong Kong dollars to all adults this year to help economic recovery.

title: N Korea paper warns against ‘poisoned candy’ amid food shortages
description: The Rodong Sinmun warns against accepting external help amid reports North Korea is teetering on brink of famine.

title: Australia, Philippines consider joint patrols in South China Sea
description: Australia's defence minister made the announcement after talks with the Philippine defence secretary.

title: Are TikTok’s ‘de-influencers’ changing attitudes on consumerism?
description: TikTok trend is getting people to think about consumer culture and its planetary impact.

title: Australia spy chief warns of espionage as US-China rivalry grows
description: More Australians targets of spying 'than at any time in Australia’s history', country's intelligence agency chief says.

title: Historic snowfall expected as winter storm slams US Midwest
description: Cold temperatures, icy blizzards and strong gusts are expected to sweep through cities like Minneapolis, Minnesota.

title: South Korea to scrap some COVID tests for travellers from China
description: South Korean authorities will no longer require arrivals from China to do a COVID test from next month.

title: Xi Jinping to visit Moscow for summit with Putin: Report
description: Top diplomat Wang Yi, who is currently in Moscow, has said ties between the two countries are 'rock solid'.

title: Biden administration issues proposal to restrict asylum seekers
description: The new rule would make asylum seekers ineligible for US protection if they 'circumvent' legal pathways.

title: Russians make Thailand a refuge as Ukraine war enters second year
description: Russians are buying up property in Southeast Asian country to avoid conscription and the economic ravages of war.

title: US judge says 9/11 families not entitled to Afghan bank funds
description: District judge says victims cannot seize bank assets since US has not recognised the Taliban as a legitimate government.

title: Mosquito-borne diseases become climate reality in warming Pacific
description: Disease surveillance by the WHO shows mosquito-borne diseases such as malaria and dengue fever are rising sharply.
